node.title: COVID-19 world latest: Experts predict Omicron wave to get worse, another tennis star joins 'Novax' in detention
node.description: Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world overnight.
node.content: ["Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world overnight.\u00a0", "US", "COVID-19 hospitalizations in the United States are poised to hit a new high as early as Friday (local time), according to a Reuters tally, surpassing the record set in January of last year as the highly contagious Omicron variant fuels a surge in the number of cases.", "Hospitalizations have increased steadily since late December as Omicron quickly overtook Delta as the dominant strain. The United States reported 662,000 new COVID cases on Thursday, the fourth highest daily US total ever recorded.", "Deaths, an indicator that lags behind hospitalisations, remain fairly steady at 1400 a day.", "Citigroup will begin enforcing a previously announced \"no-jab, no job\" policy as of January 14, according to a source familiar with the matter, making it the first major Wall Street institution to implement a strict COVID-19 vaccine mandate.", "Conservative justices on Friday questioned the legality of President Joe Biden's vaccine-or-testing mandate for large businesses.", "Mexico", "Mexico is likely to surpass 300,000 deaths from COVID-19 this week - the fifth highest death toll worldwide - as infections rise after the holiday season, fueled by the Omicron coronavirus variant and largely unrestricted tourism. Separate government data showed there had been nearly 452,000 deaths \"linked to\" COVID-19 by mid-December, and lower testing has likely helped to understate the reach of the virus.", "Brazil", "President Jair Bolsonaro criticised Brazil's health regulator Anvisa on Thursday for authorising the vaccination of children aged five to 11 years against COVID-19, one day after his health minister unveiled plans to inoculate that age group.", "\"What is behind this? What are the interests of vaccine maniacs?\" he said.", "Insufficient testing and a data blackout caused by hackers have left Brazil in the dark as it grapples with a wave of infections from the Omicron variant.", "Sweden", "Sweden set a new daily record for COVID-19 cases for the third time this week, registering 23,877 cases on January 5, health agency data showed on Friday, as a fourth wave swept the country and piled pressure on its healthcare system.", "Sweden, which has spurned hard lockdowns through the pandemic, tightened restrictions on public gatherings last month and has urged all who can to work from home in an effort to minimize the spread of the virus.", "Germany", "German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and regional leaders tightened the rules for restaurant and bar visits but shortened COVID-19 quarantine periods on Friday in response to the Omicron variant.", "UK", "Britain's Ministry of Defence on Friday said that it had begun the deployment of the military to support hospitals experiencing staff shortages and extreme pressures due to record COVID-19 cases in the country.", "France", "France reported 328,000 new cases and 193 deaths. The current COVID-19 wave engulfing France could reach its peak in around 10 days time, said an official responsible for the country's vaccine strategy.", "Italy", "Italy reported 108,304 COVID-19 related cases on Friday, less than half from a day earlier, the health ministry said, reflecting fewer tests being carried out on a national holiday. The number of deaths rose to 223 from 198.", "Austria", "Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer has tested positive for the coronavirus, the chancellery said on Friday, adding that he was in self-isolation and was not showing symptoms.", "\"There is no need to worry, I am fine and doing well,\" the chancellery quoted Nehammer as saying.", "India", "India's daily COVID-19 cases jumped to 117,100 on Friday, a five-fold increase in a week and on course to overtake its previous infection peak as the fast-spreading Omicron variant replaces Delta in cities.", "One local expert said India's high rate of infection during a previous major wave in April and May, as well as vaccinations, would mean a reduction in the severity of the illness for those infected by the Omicron variant.", "Australia", "The Omicron outbreak in Australia's most-populous state could peak by the end of January, official modelling showed on Friday, as authorities reinstated some restrictions in a bid to slow the record spike in infections.", "A second Australian Open participant has been placed into detention in a sweep by authorities on those who entered the country under the same vaccination exemption as Novak Djokovic.", "Thailand", "Thailand will extend the suspension of its quarantine waiver programme and bring in new restrictions after a jump in new coronavirus cases linked to the Omicron variant.", "Pakistan", "Pakistan's largest city Karachi is launching a door-to-door campaign to vaccinate women, who are lagging behind men in rates of coronavirus inoculation as the country enters a fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, a senior official said on Friday.", "Hong Kong", "Ten Hong Kong government officials, including the heads of home affairs and immigration, were among more than 100 people sent into quarantine after attending a banquet where two guests tested positive for COVID-19, health authorities said on Friday.", "COVID-19 infections continued to disrupt Africa Cup of Nations preparations as Egypt cancelled training and delayed their departure to the tournament in Cameroon while Guinea were forced to leave three players behind at their training base in Rwanda.", "Reuters / Newshub."]
